document.heading: Conversion Fee Clarification and Technical Amendment Act of 2008

history.narrative: Law 17-354, the “Conversion Fee Clarification and Technical Amendment Act of 2008”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-179 which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Consumer Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 18, 2008, and December 16, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 16, 2009, it was assigned Act No. 17-688 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-354 became effective on March 25, 2009.

AN ACT IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA To amend the Rental Housing Conversion and Sale Act of 1980 to eliminate the vacancy exception to the payment of the condominium conversion fee, to provide for exceptions to the payment of the condominium conversion fee when a unit is sold to a low-income household, an existing tenant, or certain elderly or persons with disabilities, to establish a new procedure for the payment of the fee, to standardize the means of determining income qualifications, and to eliminate the vacancy exemption if the vacancy is the result of illicit conduct by the housing provider.
